title: RMP scope & lifecycle coverage
requirement_text: RMP identifies the device and the life‑cycle phases for which each element applies.
acceptance_criteria: RMP names device and versions; matrices mapping plan elements to life‑cycle phases.
expected_artifacts: Risk Management Plan (RMP) vX; lifecycle applicability table.
guidance_notes: Annex A explains why scope is critical for objectivity.

title: Responsibilities & authorities
requirement_text: Assign responsibilities and authorities for all risk management activities.
acceptance_criteria: Named owners/approvers for each activity; RACI chart in plan.
expected_artifacts: RMP section with RACI; signatures/approvals.
guidance_notes: TR24971 shows typical roles and knowledge areas.

title: Review of RM activities
requirement_text: Define requirements for reviews of RM activities (e.g., design reviews, periodic RM check‑ins).
acceptance_criteria: Planned reviews with frequency/triggers; meeting minutes stored; issues tracked to closure.
expected_artifacts: Design review minutes; RM review logs.
guidance_notes: Align reviews with design controls and PMS feedback.

title: Criteria for risk acceptability
requirement_text: Define criteria for risk acceptability, including cases where probability of occurrence of harm cannot be estimated.
acceptance_criteria: Risk criteria table/matrix defined; rules for ‘probability unknown’ documented; applies per device scope.
expected_artifacts: Risk criteria appendix in RMP; risk matrix legend.
guidance_notes: TR24971 offers qualitative/semi‑quantitative scales and cautions about matrix design & rationale.

title: Method for overall residual risk
requirement_text: Define the method and criteria for evaluating overall residual risk, in relation to benefits of intended use.
acceptance_criteria: Documented method (e.g., aggregation + expert/clinical judgement); criteria defined; sources of benefit evidence identified.
expected_artifacts: Overall Residual Risk Method section; clinical/benefit evidence list.
guidance_notes: TR24971 gives examples of methods and evidence sources.

title: Verification planning
requirement_text: Plan verification of implementation and effectiveness of risk control measures.
acceptance_criteria: Verification strategy linked to each control; protocols defined or referenced; pass/fail criteria.
expected_artifacts: Verification protocol(s); V&V plan; test reports.
guidance_notes: Annex A stresses early planning of verification resources.

title: P&PP information collection & review
requirement_text: Define methods to collect and review production and post‑production information and feed back into RM.
acceptance_criteria: Defined sources, cadence, ownership, analysis methods, escalation routes.
expected_artifacts: PMS plan; complaint handling SOP; literature search plan.
guidance_notes: TR24971 aligns with ISO 13485 §§7–8 and ISO/TR 20416 PMS guidance.

title: Plan change control
requirement_text: Maintain a record of changes to the RMP over the device life cycle.
acceptance_criteria: Version history present; changes justified and approved; RMF updated.
expected_artifacts: RMP revision log; change control tickets.
guidance_notes: Annex A notes change records facilitate audit and review.

title: Risk Management File (RMF) & traceability
requirement_text: Establish and maintain an RMF. Provide traceability from each identified hazard to risk analysis, risk evaluation, implementation & verification of controls, and residual risk evaluation.
acceptance_criteria: Traceability matrix complete for all hazards; RMF collects or points to all required records; retrievable in timely fashion.
expected_artifacts: RMF index; traceability matrix/baseline; pointers into QMS repositories.
guidance_notes: TR24971 clarifies RMF is a logical construct; can point to other systems; recommends a hazard‑centric index.

title: Conduct & record risk analysis
requirement_text: Perform risk analysis per 5.2–5.5 and record results, including device ID, analysts/organizations, scope, and date.
acceptance_criteria: Analysis package includes required identifiers and dates; results trace to RMF.
expected_artifacts: Risk Analysis dossier; cover sheet with meta‑data.
guidance_notes: TR24971 provides technique guidance (e.g., FMEA, FTA); reuse of similar device analyses allowed with justification.

title: Intended use documented
requirement_text: Document intended use considering indication, patient population, body part/tissue, user profile, use environment, and operating principle.
acceptance_criteria: Use specification present and consistent across DHF and labeling; stored in RMF.
expected_artifacts: Use specification; user needs; intended purpose statement.
guidance_notes: TR24971 lists factors and links to usability engineering inputs.

title: Reasonably foreseeable misuse
requirement_text: Document reasonably foreseeable misuse; consider predictable human behaviour and use errors.
acceptance_criteria: Misuse scenarios identified and justified; linkage to HFE/validation or field data.
expected_artifacts: Misuse log; HFE reports; post‑market signals.
guidance_notes: TR24971 explains deriving misuse via simulated/actual use and HFE.

title: Characteristics related to safety
requirement_text: Identify and document qualitative/quantitative characteristics that could affect safety; define limits where appropriate.
acceptance_criteria: Characteristics list complete with limits/tolerances; link to essential performance where applicable.
expected_artifacts: Characteristics inventory; engineering specs; acceptance limits.
guidance_notes: TR24971 offers guiding questions to elicit characteristics.

title: Hazards & hazardous situations
requirement_text: Identify known and foreseeable hazards; for each hazard, identify sequences/combinations of events leading to hazardous situations across life‑cycle stages.
acceptance_criteria: Comprehensive hazard list with linked hazardous situations; life‑cycle coverage; interfaces considered.
expected_artifacts: Hazard list; event trees/FTAs; interface analysis.
guidance_notes: TR24971 Annexes give examples and techniques; systematic methods recommended.

title: Risk estimation per hazardous situation
requirement_text: For each hazardous situation, estimate the associated risk(s) using available data; define severity and probability approach; handle cases where probability cannot be estimated per policy.
acceptance_criteria: Documented rationale, data sources, and calculation/scoring; treatment for ‘unknown probability’ aligns with RMP.
expected_artifacts: Risk estimation tables; datasets; literature review logs.
guidance_notes: TR24971 provides example scales and matrices; document rationale and avoid over‑granularity.

title: Risk evaluation vs criteria
requirement_text: Compare estimated risks against criteria for acceptability; if acceptable, treat as residual risk; otherwise proceed to risk control.
acceptance_criteria: Evaluation outcome recorded for each hazardous situation; consistent application of criteria.
expected_artifacts: Risk evaluation tables; sign‑offs.
guidance_notes: TR24971: manufacturer sets criteria in policy/RMP; examples in Annex C.

title: Risk control option analysis (priority order)
requirement_text: Determine risk control measures and select options in priority: (a) inherently safe design/manufacture; (b) protective measures; (c) information for safety and training.
acceptance_criteria: Controls chosen reflect priority order unless justified; rationale documented; relevant standards considered.
expected_artifacts: Risk control option analysis log; design changes; protective features; IFU/training plans.
guidance_notes: TR24971 expands examples for each option and their effect on probability/severity.

title: Record selected measures & impracticability
requirement_text: Record selected measures; if further reduction is not practicable, trigger benefit‑risk analysis.
acceptance_criteria: Records show selected controls and any impracticability analysis with justification.
expected_artifacts: RCA for impracticability; technical assessments.
guidance_notes: Align with state of the art and feasibility analysis.

title: Implement selected measures
requirement_text: Implement all selected risk control measures.
acceptance_criteria: Links from controls to design outputs/process controls; implementation evidence stored.
expected_artifacts: Design outputs; process qualifications.

title: Verify implementation
requirement_text: Verify implementation of each risk control measure.
acceptance_criteria: Objective evidence that each control exists as designed (tests/inspection).
expected_artifacts: Verification protocols & reports; DHR evidence.
guidance_notes: Verification may occur in design verification or process qualification.

title: Verify effectiveness
requirement_text: Verify the effectiveness of risk control measures in reducing risk.
acceptance_criteria: Evidence that severity/probability reduction was realized; method appropriate (validation, user testing, etc.).
expected_artifacts: Validation reports; user studies; performance tests.
guidance_notes: Examples include dose accuracy verification or process qualification linking to risk reduction.

title: Residual risk evaluation (per HS)
requirement_text: After implementing controls, evaluate residual risk for each hazardous situation against acceptability criteria; iterate if not acceptable.
acceptance_criteria: Residual risk recorded; next actions defined for non‑acceptable risks.
expected_artifacts: Residual risk tables; decision logs.

title: Benefit‑risk analysis (BRA)
requirement_text: If residual risk is not acceptable and further control is not practicable, perform BRA to determine if benefits outweigh residual risk.
acceptance_criteria: BRA present with data/literature; conclusion documented; if benefits do not outweigh risk, modify device or intended use.
expected_artifacts: BRA report; clinical/market data; expert panel minutes.
guidance_notes: Follow TR24971 guidance for BRA execution and documentation.

title: Risks arising from controls
requirement_text: Review whether risk controls introduce new hazards or affect previously estimated risks; manage any new/increased risks.
acceptance_criteria: Assessment documented post‑implementation; new risks fed back into analysis.
expected_artifacts: Change impact assessments; updated analyses.

title: Completeness of risk control
requirement_text: Review risk control activities for completeness across all identified hazardous situations.
acceptance_criteria: Checklist completed; evidence that all planned controls were implemented and verified.
expected_artifacts: Completeness review record; sign‑off.

title: Overall residual risk evaluation
requirement_text: After implementing and verifying all controls, evaluate overall residual risk in relation to benefits, using method/criteria defined in RMP.
acceptance_criteria: Documented overall evaluation with conclusion acceptable/not; references to supporting evidence.
expected_artifacts: Overall residual risk evaluation memo; clinical benefit dossier.
guidance_notes: TR24971 provides guidance on methods and disclosure of significant residual risks.

title: Disclosure of significant residual risks
requirement_text: Inform users of significant residual risks in accompanying documentation.
acceptance_criteria: Labeling/IFU includes residual risk disclosures; cross‑referenced in RMF.
expected_artifacts: IFU, labeling change history; RMF cross‑refs.

title: Risk management review & report
requirement_text: Prior to commercial release, review execution of the RMP to ensure plan was implemented, overall residual risk is acceptable, and P&PP methods are in place; record results as the Risk Management Report (RMR) and include in RMF; responsibility assigned in RMP.
acceptance_criteria: Approved RMR present; confirms criteria; identifies any conditions of release; reviewer has appropriate authority.
expected_artifacts: Risk Management Report; RMP section listing responsible reviewer; approvals.
guidance_notes: TR24971 notes RMR can be updated when new information emerges.

title: System for P&PP monitoring
requirement_text: Establish, document, and maintain a system to actively collect and review safety‑relevant information during production and post‑production; consider appropriate collection and processing methods.
acceptance_criteria: PMS system/procedures defined; active and passive sources listed; responsibilities and tools defined.
expected_artifacts: PMS Plan; complaint handling SOP; vigilance/field action procedures; data pipelines.
guidance_notes: TR24971 emphasizes the feedback loop to keep RM continuous; aligns with ISO 13485 and ISO/TR 20416.

title: Information collection — sources
requirement_text: Collect information as applicable: production/process monitoring; user and servicing feedback; supply chain inputs; publicly available information; and state of the art; also consider similar devices and other products.
acceptance_criteria: Evidence of routine ingestion from listed sources; periodic literature/signal review; competitor/alternative therapy monitoring.
expected_artifacts: Supplier quality records; service logs; complaint database; literature review logs.
guidance_notes: TR24971 explains typical sources and the value of prior experience with similar devices.

title: Information review & escalation
requirement_text: Review collected information for relevance to safety (e.g., new hazards, risks no longer acceptable) and feed back into earlier RM phases with appropriate actions.
acceptance_criteria: Signal review minutes; triggers documented; updates to hazard analysis/RMP; CAPA as needed.
expected_artifacts: Signal management SOP; safety review board minutes; RM updates.
guidance_notes: TR24971 details the continuous feedback loop and alignment with PMS.

title: Risk matrices & scales documented
requirement_text: If using qualitative or semi‑quantitative scales/matrices, document definitions, ranges, and rationale for chosen matrix size and cut‑points.
acceptance_criteria: Matrix legend and definitions approved; justification for scale choice; avoid excessive levels without data support.
expected_artifacts: Risk matrix appendix; probability/severity definitions.
guidance_notes: TR24971 includes example 3×3 and 5×5 matrices and warns about data needs for >5 levels.

title: Traceability approach documented
requirement_text: Document the traceability method/tool linking hazards → analysis → evaluation → controls → residual risk → overall evaluation.
acceptance_criteria: Traceability index is complete and stays current through changes; retrievable quickly.
expected_artifacts: Traceability matrix; RMF index.
guidance_notes: TR24971 recommends a hazard‑centric index and keeping it current as devices change.
